item.title: London Stocks Fall in Early Trade
item.description: The FTSE 100 fell 0.2% in early action, as optimism following a tentattive deal on the U.S. debt ceiling gave way to ongoing concerns about further Fed interest-rate rises.

item.title: Euro Falls to Two-Month Low Vs Dollar, Confidence Data Could Knock It Further
item.description: The euro hit a two-month low against a broadly firmer dollar and could fall further if eurozone industrial and consumer confidence figures for May, due at 0900 GMT, weaken, ING said.

item.title: Oil Slips on Doubts Over US Debt Deal
item.description: Oil prices dipped in European trading on concerns that Joe Biden’s debt-ceiling deal could struggle to win congressional support, while focus was also on the upcoming OPEC meeting.

item.title: Metals Slip Amid Mixed Macro Signals
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were falling in Europe with investors looking at the progress in the debt-ceiling talks and to the U.S. job numbers this week, and their effect on the dollar, Peak Trading said.

item.title: Spanish Bonds Could Benefit From More Fiscal Prudence After National Elections
item.description: Spanish government bonds could benefit from more fiscal prudence after snap elections in July, Citi said.

item.title: Drones Hit Residential Areas in Moscow for First Time
item.description: Drones struck several buildings in the first attacks on civilian areas deep inside Russia since the invasion of Ukraine last year, as Kyiv spent another night under air assault.

item.title: China Rebuffs Pentagon Chief, Blunting Rapprochement Push
item.description: A U.S. request for a meeting of Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and China’s Defense Minister Li Shangfu was declined, showing the limits of a tentative rapprochement between the two powers.

item.title: Blackstone's Crown Resorts Agrees to Penalty for High-Risk Practices
item.description: Crown Resorts agreed to a A$450 million penalty over breaches of anti-money-laundering and counterterrorism laws prior to the casino operator’s acquisition by Blackstone.

item.title: Daimler Truck, Toyota to Merge Parts of Asian Businesses
item.description: Daimler Truck and Toyota plan to to combine their Mitsubishi Fuso Truck and Hino operations and list the new company on the Tokyo stock exchange.

item.title: China Launches Three Astronauts, Including First Civilian, Into Orbit
item.description: The liftoff showcases the nation’s expanding capabilities in space at a time when mounting military and technological competition with the U.S. is stoking geopolitical tension.

item.title: UK Shop-Price Inflation Hits Record
item.description: Prices at U.K. stores in the first week of May were 9% higher on year, a new record high, but food inflation slowed slightly, as lower energy and commodity costs started to ease.

item.title: Rights Group Revisits Report on Missing Uyghur Scholar After Questions Emerge
item.description: Amnesty International said it feared Abuduwaili Abudureheman had disappeared into Chinese custody in Hong Kong, but new reports indicate he’s in South Korea.

item.title: The Miami Heat's Long Shot Journey to the NBA Finals
item.description: The Heat became just the second No. 8 seeded team to make it to the Finals, after the New York Knicks did it in 1999.

item.title: China's Fading Recovery Reveals Deeper Economic Struggles
item.description: Ballooning debt, tepid consumption and worsening relations with the West are set to weigh on future growth, economists say.

item.title: China's Fading Recovery Reveals Deeper Economic Struggles
item.description: Ballooning debt, tepid consumption and worsening relations with the West are set to weigh on future growth, economists say.

item.title: Biden, McCarthy's Debt-Ceiling Deal Faces Crucial First Test in House
item.description: Congress has just a few days to pass a bill before the June 5 deadline and avoid an unprecedented default.

item.title: Disney's "The Little Mermaid" sold $95.5 million in domestic tickets in its first three days, leading the weekend movie box office.
item.description: Disney’s “The Little Mermaid” sold $95.5 million in domestic tickets in its first three days, leading the weekend movie box office.

item.title: Tensions are rising between Saudi Arabia and Russia as Moscow keeps pumping huge volumes of cheaper crude, undermining Riyadh's efforts to boost energy prices, people familiar with the matter say.
item.description: Tensions are rising between Saudi Arabia and Russia as Moscow keeps pumping huge volumes of cheaper crude, undermining Riyadh’s efforts to boost energy prices, people familiar with the matter say.

item.title: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, a standard bearer for the right, faces an impeachment trial to start Aug. 28 in the state's Senate on charges that include bribery and abuse of public trust.
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, a standard bearer for the right, faces an impeachment trial to start Aug. 28 in the state’s Senate on charges that include bribery and abuse of public trust.

item.title: Russia unleashed two waves of missiles and drones across Ukraine, in an escalating campaign to degrade the country's air defenses and disrupt preparations for an offensive that Kyiv has signaled could be imminent.
item.description: Russia unleashed two waves of missiles and drones across Ukraine, in an escalating campaign to degrade the country’s air defenses and disrupt preparations for an offensive that Kyiv has signaled could be imminent.
